'Hydrazoic acid', also known as 'hydrogen azide' or 'azoimide', is a
colorless, volatile, and explosive liquid at room temperature and pressure. It
is a compound of nitrogen and hydrogen, having chemical formula
HN 3. It was first isolated in 1890 by Theodor
Curtius. The acid has few applications, but its conjugate base, the
azide ion, is useful in specialized processes.
